sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"上升，举起"之意。
means: arise ：书面用词，多用于诗歌或比喻中，具有特殊的修辞色彩。
rise ：普通用词，指具体的或抽象的事物由低向高移动。
raise ：及物动词，常用词，多指把某物从低处升到高处，有时作引申用。
lift ：语气比raise强，指用体力或机械的力举起或抬起某物。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"升起，举起"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: lift, hoist, raise, elevate, heave, boost
means: lift ： 指用人力或机械力把某物升到较高的位置。
hoist ： 多指用绳索、滑轮等机械把重物升起。
raise ： 较正式用词，常可与lift换用，但强调把某物举起或抬起到应有的高度。常用比喻。
elevate ： 较正式用词，指位置、高度的升高，多作比喻用，指职位、品德等的提高。
heave ： 指需花大力气或借外力才能举起或抬起重物。
boost ： 原义指从后面或下面推起或提高，现常用于指提高价格、振作精神等抽象概念。

sentence.Network_en: The organisers hope to raise as much as £6m for charity.
sentence.Network_cn: 组织者希望能募集到高达600万英镑的善款。

sentence.Network_en: Every year we have charity days to raise money for unfortunate people.
sentence.Network_cn: 每年我们都有慈善日来筹款帮助贫困人群。

sentence.Network_en: It seemed like a good neighbourhood to raise my children.
sentence.Network_cn: 它看起来像是一个有利于我的孩子们成长的理想居住区。

lj.lj_ly: she raised her hand to me.

jx.jx_en_mean: briefly remove one's hat as a gesture of courtesy or respect to someone
make or cause someone else to make a great deal of noise, especially through cheering
jx.jx_cn_mean: 喧闹不休；闹翻了天；吵翻了天

lj.lj_ly: when I finally scored the fans raised the roof.
lj.lj_ls: 当我最终进球时，球迷们像炸开了锅一样。

jx.jx_en_mean: To behave in a rowdy or disruptive fashion.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 粗野行事：以粗野、有污辱性的方式行为或表现

phrase.cizu_name: raise Cain 或 raise the devil  或 raise hell

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse reisa; related to the verb rear

encyclopedia.content: 函数名： raise 功 能： 向正在执行的程序发送一个信号 用 法： int raise(int sig); 程序例： #include <signal.h> int main(void) { int a, b; a = 10; b = 0; if (b == 0) /* preempt divide by zero error */ raise(SIGFPE); a = a / b; return 0; }

entry.def: If you raise something, you move it so that it is in a higher position.

example.ex: He raised his hand to wave...
example.tran: 他举手挥动起来。

example.ex: She went to the window and raised the blinds...
example.tran: 她走到窗前，拉起了百叶窗。

entry.def: If you raise a flag, you display it by moving it up a pole or into a high place where it can be seen.

example.ex: They had raised the white flag in surrender...
example.tran: 他们举白旗投降了。

example.ex: At midnight, the German flag will be raised over the Reichstag.
example.tran: 半夜时，德国国旗将在德国国会大厦升起。

entry.def: If you raise yourself, you lift your body so that you are standing up straight, or so that you are no longer lying flat.

example.ex: He raised himself into a sitting position...
example.tran: 他坐了起来。

example.ex: She raised herself on one elbow.
example.tran: 她用一只胳膊肘撑起身体。

entry.def: If you raise the rate or level of something, you increase it.

example.ex: The Republic of Ireland is expected to raise interest rates...
example.tran: 爱尔兰共和国预计会提高利率。

example.ex: Two incidents in recent days have raised the level of concern.
example.tran: 最近发生的两起事件引发了更多人的关注。

entry.def: To raise the standard of something means to improve it.

example.ex: ...a new drive to raise standards of literacy in Britain's schools.
example.tran: 提高英国学校文化水平的新运动

entry.def: If you raise your voice, you speak more loudly, usually because you are angry.

example.ex: Don't you raise your voice to me, Henry Rollins!...
example.tran: 别冲我叫嚷，亨利·罗林斯！

example.ex: Anne raised her voice in order to be heard.
example.tran: 为了让人能听得见，安妮提高了嗓门。

entry.def: A raise is an increase in your wages or salary.

example.ex: Within two months Kelly got a raise.
example.tran: 不到两个月，凯利就获得了加薪。

entry.tran: （为慈善组织、机构等）募捐，筹（款）
entry.def: If you raise money for a charity or an institution, you ask people for money which you collect on its behalf.

example.ex: ...events held to raise money for Help the Aged...
example.tran: 为“帮助老年人”活动而发起的募捐活动

example.ex: All funds raised will be used by Children With Leukaemia.
example.tran: 所有募集到的资金都将用于“白血病患儿”组织。

entry.def: If a person or company raises money that they need, they manage to get it, for example by selling their property or by borrowing.

example.ex: They raised the money to buy the house and two hundred acres of grounds.
example.tran: 他们筹钱来购买房屋及200英亩的土地。

entry.def: If an event raises a particular emotion or question, it makes people feel the emotion or consider the question.

example.ex: The agreement has raised hopes that the war may end soon...
example.tran: 那项协议使人们感到战争有望很快结束。

example.ex: The accident again raises questions about the safety of the plant.
example.tran: 这起事故再一次引发了人们对于工厂安全性的质疑。

entry.def: If you raise a subject, an objection, or a question, you mention it or bring it to someone's attention.

example.ex: In the meeting Mrs. Ashrawi raised the three main concerns that the Palestinians had...
example.tran: 会议上，阿什拉维夫人提出了巴勒斯坦人最为关注的三个问题。

example.ex: He had been consulted and had raised no objections.
example.tran: 事先征求了他的意见，他并没有提出异议。

entry.def: Someone who raises a child looks after it until it is grown up.

example.ex: My mother was an amazing woman. She raised four of us kids virtually singlehandedly.
example.tran: 我的母亲是位了不起的女性。她几乎是一个人把我们4个孩子带大的。

example.ex: ...the house where she was raised.
example.tran: 她在其间长大的那幢房子

entry.def: If someone raises a particular type of animal or crop, they breed that type of animal or grow that type of crop.

example.ex: He raises 2,000 acres of wheat and hay.
example.tran: 他种植了2,000英亩的小麦和牧草。

example.ex: ...a perfectly cooked farm-raised chicken.
example.tran: 精心烹制的农场养的鸡

means.word_mean: 1. the amount a salary is increased;
2. an upward slope or grade (as in a road);

sentences.sentence: "the car couldn't make it up the rise"

means.word_mean: 3. increasing the size of a bet (as in poker);

sentences.sentence: "I'll see your raise and double it"
"he responded with a lift of his eyebrow"
"fireman learn several different raises for getting ladders up"

means.word_mean: 1. raise the level or amount of something;
2. raise from a lower to a higher position;
3. cause to be heard or known; express or utter;
4. collect funds for a specific purpose;

sentences.sentence: "The President raised several million dollars for his college"

means.word_mean: 5. cultivate by growing, often involving improvements by means of agricultural techniques;

sentences.sentence: "The Bordeaux region produces great red wines"

means.word_mean: 7. evoke or call forth, with or as if by magic;

sentences.sentence: "he conjured wild birds in the air"
"call down the spirits from the mountain"

means.word_mean: 11. create a disturbance, especially by making a great noise;

sentences.sentence: "The new law lifted many people from poverty"

means.word_mean: 14. give a promotion to or assign to a higher position;

sentences.sentence: "John was kicked upstairs when a replacement was hired"
"Women tend not to advance in the major law firms"
"I got promoted after many years of hard work"

means.word_mean: 15. cause to puff up with a leaven;
16. in bridge: bid (one's partner's suit) at a higher level
17. bet more than the previous player
18. cause to assemble or enlist in the military;
19. put forward for consideration or discussion;
20. pronounce (vowels) by bringing the tongue closer to the roof of the mouth;

sentences.sentence: "They managed to raise Hanoi last night"

means.word_mean: 23. multiply (a number) by itself a specified number of times: 8 is 2 raised to the power 3
24. bring (a surface, a design, etc.) into relief and cause to project;

sentences.sentence: "Slavery is already dead, and cannot be resurrected"

auth_sentence.content: Companies and public institutions issue bonds to raise money.
auth_sentence.res_content: Companies and public institutions issue bonds to raise money.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Companies and public institutions issue bonds to raise money.

auth_sentence.content: In most years the pair will raise two broods.
auth_sentence.res_content: In most years the pair will raise two broods.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In most years the pair will raise two broods.

auth_sentence.content: Higher temperatures can raise sea levels in several ways.
auth_sentence.res_content: Higher temperatures can raise sea levels in several ways.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Higher temperatures can raise sea levels in several ways.

stems_affixes.word_buile: rais升起,唤醒+e→n.&v.上升, 提出 n.高地
rais升起,唤醒+e→n.&v.上升, 提出 n.高地

Sentence.sentence: It found that human-influenced climate change was raising the global death rates from illnesses including malnutrition (营养不良)and heat-related health problems.
The rising cost of raising a child in Britain.
A US study suggested that when a school gave children access to a natural environment, academic levels were raised across the entire school.

means.word_mean: 提起; 举起; 竖起

sentences.en: When he saw the principal, he raised his hand in salutation.
sentences.cn: 他看到校长时举手敬礼。

sentences.en: I'll raise both hands in favour of damming the river.
sentences.cn: 我举双手赞成拦河筑坝。

sentences.en: From then on we raised our heads and became our own masters.
sentences.cn: 从此我们抬起头来当家做主了。

sentences.en: Slowly he raised his bow and began to take aim at the bird.
sentences.cn: 慢慢地他举起弓, 开始瞄准那只鸟。

sentences.en: Raise the overturned lamp.
sentences.cn: 扶起倒了的灯。

sentences.en: They raised their output by more than half in less than three years.
sentences.cn: 不到三年, 他们把产量提高了一半还多。

sentences.en: We must do everything we can to raise the people's living standards.
sentences.cn: 我们要想一切办法来提高人民的生活水平。

sentences.en: None of them raised any objection.
sentences.cn: 他们谁也没提出反对意见。

sentences.en: Why didn't you raise the question at the meeting?
sentences.cn: 这问题你怎么没有在会上提出来?

sentences.en: As no one raised his voice against the plan, it was agreed on.
sentences.cn: 由于没有人提反对意见, 那项计划便通过了。

sentences.en: They decided to raise money by subscription.
sentences.cn: 他们决定靠募捐的办法来筹集这笔款子。

sentences.en: How were they going to raise enough money for it?
sentences.cn: 他们怎样来为此筹集足够的资金呢?

sentences.en: They increased their income by raising silkworms and so on.
sentences.cn: 他们靠养蚕等增加了收入。

sentences.en: The old man likes raising rabbits, chickens, dogs and horses.
sentences.cn: 这个老人喜欢养兔子、鸡、狗和马。

sentences.en: They raised five thousand chrysanthemums last year.
sentences.cn: 去年他们种了五千株菊花。

sentences.en: We want to raise our children to be decent men and women.
sentences.cn: 我们盼望把孩子们培养成优秀人才。

sentences.en: This book raised my interest in the study of history.
sentences.cn: 这本书引起了我研究历史的兴趣。

means.word_mean: 提高(价格等)；增加(尺寸、数量等)

sentences.en: They raised the price of rice from $1.5 to $2.5 per kilogram.
sentences.cn: 他们将米价由每公斤1.5美元提高到2.5美元。

sentences.en: He raised his voice but still I could not hear him.
sentences.cn: 他提高了嗓门，但我依然听不见他说什么。

sentences.en: His words raised a blush on her cheeks.
sentences.cn: 他的话使她脸红。

means.word_mean: 【航海学】使…进入视线；看得见(地平线上的事物)

sentences.en: Now we raised a ship far away on the horizon.
sentences.cn: 现在我们看到远处的地平线上有一艘轮船。

sentences.en: He went to ask for a raise.
sentences.cn: 他要求增加工资。

sentences.en: The workers went on strike for a raise.
sentences.cn: 工人举行罢工, 要求增加工资。

sentences.en: The trade unions bargained away their rights in exchange for a small pay raise.
sentences.cn: 工会不惜牺牲自己的权利以换取微薄的加薪。

sentences.en: She raised higher and higher in the sofa.
sentences.cn: 她的身子在沙发里越挪越高。

jushi.english: From then on we raised our heads and became our own masters.
jushi.chinese: 从此我们抬起头来当家做主了。

jushi.english: They were all looking a bit miserable but Barry soon raised a laugh by telling a few jokes.
jushi.chinese: 他们看上去有点难受,但巴里的几个笑话却顿时使气氛活跃了起来。

jushi.english: The disco party raised the roof until the small hours of the morning.
jushi.chinese: 那场迪斯科舞会吵闹至凌晨才结束。
